content:
#### 7. What can Affect Your Entitlement
If You do not comply with any condition of Your Policy, it may affect the coverage and benefits afforded by this Policy.

#### 8. Interests of Other Persons
You must not transfer or assign Your interest in the Policy to another person without first obtaining Our written consent. If anyone else has an interest in Your Policy (for example, the legal owner of Your car through a hire purchase or leasing agreement or employer's loan), We are bound to extend the insurance to them only after You have informed Us about their interest in writing and We have agreed in writing to enter their name and interest on Your Policy. However, Our doing so does not make You an agent or trustee for them or assign Your rights and interests to them.
questions: What might happen if I fail to comply with a condition of my insurance policy?
Can I transfer my insurance policy to someone else?
What is required to assign my interest in an insurance policy to another person?
What happens if someone else has a legal interest in an item covered by my insurance policy?
Do I need to inform my insurance company if someone else has an interest in my insured property?
What is the process to get another person's name and interest included in my insurance policy?
Does informing my insurance about another person's interest in my policy make me their agent?
What written consents are needed to transfer an insurance policy interest?
How does the insurance company handle interests of third parties in my policy?
What are the implications of not informing the insurance company about a third party's interest in my policy?
